intro: Icacorea geniculata, commonly known as the spiral iceplant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves and striking, showy flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in coastal environments and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Icacorea geniculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological benefits to local wildlife.
